name: Giacomo Mason
summary: Economist and data scientist with over four years industry experience and six years research record. PhD-level foundations in econometric modelling, causal inference, statistics, and machine learning. Diverse range of practical applications, from survey data to natural language. Data cleaning, analysis, and modelling using multiple programming languages (Python, R, Stata). Experience communicating technical findings and visualisations to internal and external stakeholders.

education.description: Student Academic Representative (StAR) for the 2014/2015 MPhil cohort. Organiser of weekly Applied Microeconometrics Reading Group.
cum laude. BA Dissertation: Distance From Markets And Consumption Inequality: Evidence From Rural Lagos
cum laude. LLP / Erasmus Programme - Copenhagen Business School, Denmark. Intl Summer Program in Management - University of Michigan. Dissertation: An Essay on Growth and Inequality.

experience.title: Senior Data Scientist
highlights: Working across two teams: Experimentation and Measurement, Consumer Behaviour Science.
Focus on customer lifetime value estimation.

experience.title: Data Scientist
highlights: Delivered an automated document ingestion pipeline to enhance document review in competition cases.
Worked on the CMAâ€™s landmark study on Online Platforms and Digital Advertising, overseeing the big-data empirical analysis for the study.
Authored the econometric analysis of a large RCT by Google.
Other projects: network modelling of company ownership relationships, network analysis of deceptive online reviews, automated scraping and analysis of social media content.
Technical skills: network analysis; large-scale webscraping; data pipelines; machine/deep learning for NLP; collaborative software development; code review.
Member of the Civil Service Digital, Data, and Technology (DDaT) profession.

experience.company: Institute for Fiscal Studies / Oxford Policy Management
experience.title: Research Consultant
highlights: Evaluation of the Child Development Grant Programme, a clustered RCT in northern Nigeria.
Led the design of the household survey, and the entire data analysis process.
Technical skills: survey programming, data cleaning, causal inference with panel data, visualisation.

experience.title: PhD Researcher, Economics
highlights: Supervisors: Prof. Orazio Attanasio, Prof. Gabriella Conti.
Technical skills: multivariate and regression analysis; longitudinal data; factor analysis and structural equation models; permutation and bootstrap inference; multiple hypothesis testing.

experience.company: University College London, Dept. of Economics
experience.title: Postgraduate Teaching Assistant

projects.name: Inequality in early-life socio-emotional skills: a cross-cohort comparison
highlights: Main project during PhD tenure at University College London.

projects.name: The impacts of a pregnancy lifestyle intervention on maternal outcomes
highlights: Main project during PhD tenure at University College London.

projects.name: Estimating health production functions: a control function approach
highlights: Main project during PhD tenure at University College London.
